parameters.definition: Amount of Calcium in one serving of health supplement A
Amount of Magnesium in one serving of health supplement A
Amount of Calcium in one serving of health supplement B
Amount of Magnesium in one serving of health supplement B
Cost per serving of health supplement A
Cost per serving of health supplement B
Minimum required amount of Calcium per day
Minimum required amount of Magnesium per day

description: Calcium and Magnesium are found in two health supplements, health supplement A and health supplement B. One serving of health supplement A contains \param{CaA} grams of Calcium and \param{MgA} grams of Magnesium. One serving of health supplement B contains \param{CaB} grams of Calcium and \param{MgB} grams of Magnesium. The cost per health supplement for health supplement A is \$\param{CostA} and the cost per health supplement for health supplement B is \$\param{CostB}. A patient must consume these two health supplements every day to get at least \param{MinCa} grams of Calcium and \param{MinMg} grams of Magnesium. Determine how much servings of each supplement the patient needs to minimize her daily cost.
